html:
2.11.19  8:48 pm   hey hey hey, the miller-urey experiment was a joke ok

no one can solve abiogenesis because its never been observed or successfully tested

do you believe in a deity mr wurtz

      in a universe that has to have a beginning yet nothing to make it begin, with life that has to have a beginning yet nothing to make it begin, it doesnt seem so unreasonable that perhaps something outside of limited naturalistic understanding could have been the cause - would you agree

      do you think you could go about proving something unscientific with science

      do you think very very complex interdependent system arose from chance

      as the drake equation and fermi paradox demonstrate, the chance of intelligent life being able to exist (assuming abiogenesis and macro-evolution are factual phenomenon) is literally astronomically low

     this universe is fairly convenient in my opinion,

      though i think the smartest thing anyone can do is admit they dont know

html: 2.11.19  11:46 am   So in art class we were looking at different things and determining if they were art. At one point the teacher showed us some picture of a flipped over urinal and I claimed that it didn't count as art cause the urinal was made for practical reasons. Yet she claimed that it was because of how the "artist" chose to portray it like a pice of art. So I started thinking about what really counts as art which only made me really confused. Can anything be art if considered to be? Does it depend of the perspective of the viewer? Do I sound stupid asking this question?
original_html: 2.11.19  11:46 am   So in art class we were looking at different things and determining if they were art. At one point the teacher showed us some picture of a flipped over urinal and I claimed that it didn't count as art cause the urinal was made for practical reasons. Yet she claimed that it was because of how the "artist" chose to portray it like a pice of art. So I started thinking about what really counts as art which only made me really confused. Can anything be art if considered to be? Does it depend of the perspective of the viewer? Do I sound stupid asking this question?

html: 2.11.19  5:04 am   I write my music by ear but can't get away from the same root-bass functional chords, for example Eb,G,Bb,D - DFAC and the like. I'll at least mix things up and put the 7th-tonic rub in the middle of the chord instead of on top, or find myself splitting 5ths doing root and 5th in the left hand and 3 and 7 in the right an octave up, a sus here and there but CAN'T seem to unlock my understanding of more "colored" (if you will) or nonfunctional chords and get into chromatic harmony and other techniques I hear in your writing.
